stack

public static java.awt.Dimension stack(java.awt.Dimension... dimensions)
Creates a new Dimension that is equivalent to the specified dimensions stacked one on the other.
The resulting dimension has width equal to the maximum width found in the specified dimensions and height equal to the sum of heights of the specified dimensions.

Parameters:
dimensions - Dimensions to add as a stack.
Returns:
Returns a new dimension that has enough space for all the specified dimensions to be stacked in.

increase

public static java.awt.Dimension increase(java.awt.Dimension size,
                                          int w,
                                          int h)
Creates a new Dimension sized relevant to the specified dimension and increased according to the specified width and height.

Parameters:
size - Reference dimension.
w - Width to increase the specified dimension. If this is a negative number, then the resulting dimension will have less width than the reference one.
h - Height to increase the specified dimension. If this is a negative number, then the resulting dimension will have less height than the reference one.
Returns:
Returns a new dimension with height and width resulting from the addition of the specified dimension's height and width with the specified height and width.
